page.title: 15THE BATTLE OF HASTINGS CONT.
page.content: PREPARED HIS ARMY ALONG THE SOUTH COAST BUT DISBANDED THEM ABOUT 8TH SEPTEMBER.IMMEDIATELY AFTER THIS NEWS REACHED HAROLD THAT HARALD HARDRADA OF NORWAY HAD INVADED NORTHERN ENGLAND SO HE GATHERED HIS MEN AND MARCHED NORTH. THE EARLS OF MERCIA AND NORTHUMBRIA HAD BEEN DEFEATED BY HARDRADA AT THE BATTLE OF GATE FULFORD.HAROLD DEFEATED THE NORSEMEN AT THE BATTLE OF{STAMFORD {BRIDGE}ON THE 25TH SEPTEMBER.THREE DAYS LATER WILLIAM, WHO HAD BEEN WAITING FOR THE WIND IN THE ENGLISH CHANNEL TO CHANGE DIRECTION FOR SIX WEEKS, ARRIVED IN ENGLAND.HAROLD MARCHED SOUTH, GATHERING AN ARMY AS HE CAME.MEANWHILE WILLIAM WAS BUILDING {CASTLES}AT PEVENSEY AND HASTINGS.BY 13TH OCTOBER HAROLD REACHED A POINT NEAR HASTINGS WHERE HE HOPED THE REST OF HIS ARMY WOULD JOIN HIM.HOWEVER WILLIAM WAS WARNED OF HIS APPROACH
